page.title: 11A Farmer's Year
page.content: In{Spring}the farmer prepares his land for sowing barley,oats,wheat,carrots, and oil _ seed rape.He plants potatoes and sprays the crops.He then makes silage and hay.The hay is to feed the cows in winter.In Spring the cows are calving.In{Summer}there are farm holidays then roguing the potatoes and harvesting crops.In{Autumn}the farmer lifts the potatoes by machine or a squad of helpers.Children get a week's holiday from school to help.They all agree it is very hard work but the extra money is very welcome.A maximum of Â£12.00 per day can be earned by hard workers.In{Winter}the farmer ploughs the fields and feeds the cattle with the hay and silage he made in Spring.He also grades the potatoes and sells them.As you can see a farmer's life is very busy,but is one which is very worthwhile & rewarding.
